answers.text:
Hi Kevin, 
Thank you for your question! At this time we do not have anything as specific as looking at stormwater fees on culverts but I was able to find two resources that may be of use to you. I hope when you create a plan for your local government you upload it to the Knowledge Network so others can learn from it!
-City of Cincinnati, OH cleans culverts on a reactive basis for no charge according to this manual. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/305211 (search for the word culvert to find that section)
-This local government profile discusses stormwater fees
http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9101/public/profile.cfm?title=Profile
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Kevin Helms
text: Oak Hill is re-assessing how we address maintenance of culverts within the public right-of-way, but under private driveways.  In the past, we have cleaned these structures when they are clogged.  However with less resources and no stormwater fee, this is becoming problematic.  Please tell me whether your city cleans out driveway culverts.  If so, do you levy a stormwater fee?  If not, how do you address situations where they become clogged and prevent water flow
title: Right-of-Way Maintenance
